text: I was 26 27 I was a student history
student a mature student I was the
mother of a four-year-old and I was
immersed in the activities of the
women's liberation movement with all the
talk about independence it's as well to
remember that women are still as keen as
ever to be feminine we were learning a
lot and trying to understand the world
we were living in and we felt angry
about a lot of the injustice 'as I
remembered going to a meeting with a
whole group of other people that the
women's liberation workshop offices and
I really don't know where the idea came
from except Miss World you know women
being judged by their looks and their
bodies we knew that to demonstrate
against Miss World if we were if we
could disrupt the spectacle as we called
it going into everyone's homes he would
make an impact
we had no quarrel with the contestants
our argument with was with you know why
do you have to be beautiful and you know
looked at like this before you get
noticed as a woman
there was a sense of exhilaration and
excitement that we were we were making a
mark on making ourselves heard it sort
of went plan there was a lot of security
much more security than we'd anticipated
and there was a long queue but we could
buy tickets we dressed up we didn't we
wanted to fit into the audience so we
went in with our handbags and are
looking good
inside our handbags we had little
objects we put flour into little
scrunchie scrunchie pieces of paper and
flour bombs to flick around when we were
in there we realized there were groups
of women dotted all over the hall we
could see that they were demonstrators
like us you felt oh god I've got to do
this you felt terrified we planned that
there would be a football rattle which
was which would go off at a certain time
we thought when all the candidates were
lined up on the stage the signal came
very early because the woman who had the
rattle she got so angry at the jokes
that Bob Hope was much worse shocking
and at his general demeanor and she did
rattle early so we left up was dark and
seeing other women leaping up I had to
climb over people who were horrified at
what we were doing
I was certainly determined to get onto
that stage and disrupt Bob Hope when I
first left up I could see that he look
oh you know like that and what's going
on look absolutely horrified ran
backstage absolutely terrified and he
took a long time to be persuaded to come
back on I must have got you know climbed
over the barrier towards the stage and
about four or five policemen just pulled
me off and I was carried out by my arms
and my legs out of the Albert Hall as we
were being dragged out some of the Miss
World contestants and all that the
beautiful beautiful young women in all
their baubles and you know bathing
costumes and high heels saying let them
go to the policeman we were exhilarated
by the demonstration and exhilarated by
its success and astonished by how
successful it had been I do see Miss
world as one of the one of the most
spectacular of consciousness-raising
episodes if you like I mean it did leave
its mark
[Music]
